thread.title: Liverpool's Jordan Henderson travels to Tenerife, Daniel Sturridge does not
thread.title_full: Liverpool's Jordan Henderson travels to Tenerife, Daniel Sturridge does not

author: PA Sport
title: Liverpool's Jordan Henderson travels to Tenerife, Daniel Sturridge does not
text:
13 hours ago Liverpool's Jordan Henderson travels to Tenerife, Daniel Sturridge does not Take an exclusive behind-the-scenes look of Manchester City's clash with Liverpool from inside the tunnel at the Etihad. 
Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson has travelled with the squad for warm weather training in Tenerife but striker Daniel Sturridge has been left behind. 
Manager Jurgen Klopp has taken all his senior players not on international duty -- including James Milner, Dejan Lovren, Joel Matip, Loris Karius, Alberto Moreno and Lucas Leiva -- to the Canary Islands for the week. 
Henderson has been sidelined with a foot problem since the victory over Tottenham on Feb. 11 but Klopp expects him to be fit to return for the Merseyside derby at Anfield on April 1. Sturridge has not played since coming on as a second-half substitute in the defeat at Hull on Feb. 4. 
He was sent home from the team's training camp in La Manga last month with a virus and then sustained a hip injury and Press Association Sport reports his rehabilitation will continue at Melwood while his teammates are away. 
A number of youngsters have been included to make up the numbers while the players' families have also been invited on the week-long trip.
